project_path.FUTAINU: Experiments/contracts/FUTAINU Full Smart Contract Security Audit/FUTAINU

findings.title: Owner privileges (In the period when the owner is not renounced)
findings.description: The contract owner has excessive privileges even after ownership renouncement, allowing them to lock and unlock, include or exclude from maximum transaction limit, maximum token per wallet limit, fees, reward, and change Uniswap router and pair.
findings.function: Multiple functions (e.g., setTreasuryWallet, updateFees, setMaxTxAmount, etc.)

findings.title: Potential lock and unlock functionality abuse
findings.description: Owner can retake privileges even after the ownership was renounced by using lock and unlock functions.

findings.title: Unrestricted maximum transaction limit modification
findings.description: The owner has unrestricted privileges to change the maximum transaction limit.

findings.title: Unrestricted maximum token per wallet limit modification
findings.description: The owner has unrestricted privileges to modify the maximum token per wallet limit.

findings.title: Treasure wallet address change vulnerability
findings.description: Owner can change treasure wallet address.

findings.title: Fees modification vulnerability
findings.description: The fees can be modified by an unauthorized user due to the lack of access control in certain functions.

findings.title: Reward modification vulnerability
findings.description: Owner can include in and exclude from reward.

findings.title: Tax, liquidity, and treasure fees modification vulnerability
findings.description: Owner can change tax, liquidity and treasure fees.

findings.title: Swap and liquify enable/disable functionality abuse
findings.description: Owner can enable / disable swap and liquify.

findings.title: Uniswap router and pair modification vulnerability
findings.description: Owner can change Uniswap router and pair.

findings.title: Autoliquidity exclusion/inclusion vulnerability
findings.description: The functions includeInReward() and _getCurrentSupply() use loops to find and remove addresses from the _excluded list, which can cause an OUT_OF_GAS exception if the excluded addresses list is too long.
